title: Issues loading docbook-xml after install

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I am trying to install wayland with spack but it requires docbook-xsl and docbook-xml to be loaded in modules. Both xml and xsl have been installed with spack with the following commands, 

``$ spack install docbook-xml``
``$ spack install docbook-xsl``

When I try to load xml into my module I receive the following error
``$ module load docbook-xml-4.5-gcc-10.2.0-bs4kifb``
``-bash: eval: --: invalid option``
``eval: usage: eval [arg ...]``

### Steps to reproduce the issue
OS: Centos 7
Spack version: 0.15.4-1446-08e30a2


Modules loaded 
``  1) autotools   3) gnu8/8.3.0       5) ohpc                                 7) libxml2-2.9.10-gcc-10.2.0-4xuwlge            9) gcc-10.2.0-gcc-8.3.0-af6hrdh
  2) prun/1.3    4) openmpi3/3.1.4   6) graphviz-2.44.1-gcc-10.2.0-4hyoxfi   8) xorg-sgml-doctools-1.11-gcc-10.2.0-uzldscv  10) libxslt-1.1.33-gcc-10.2.0-fcpv73n``

``$ module load docbook-xml-4.5-gcc-10.2.0-bs4kifb``
``-bash: eval: --: invalid option``
``eval: usage: eval [arg ...]``

I receive the same error when I try to load docbook-xsl

### Error Message

``-bash: eval: --: invalid option``
``eval: usage: eval [arg ...]``



I tried to edit spacks modulefile for docbook-xml and xsl and found the issue to be in this command: 

``setenv --delim " " XML_CATALOG_FILES "/opt/ohpc/pub/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-sandybridge/gcc-10.2.0/docbook-xml-4.5-bs4kifbercjv2pz6pgvttwvto6qhw5ad/catalog.xml"``

If I remove --delim " " from the modulefile I no longer get the error when loading the modules however, wayland fails to install with the following error:

     ``151    checking for docbook stylesheets... no``
     ``152    configure: error: Documentation build requested but docbook-xsl stylesheets are not found. Install the docbook-xsl package or disable the documentation using --disable-documentation``


### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [ ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

<!-- We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively!

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack! -->



Thank you for any help you can provide
